summary: The document is a declassified CIA file from June 1977, detailing Juan Falcon Tamar's claims and activities as a coordinator of the MRR (Revolutionary Recovery Movement) in Cuba. Falcon alleged CIA support for his operations against Cuba, including sabotage and assassination plots against Cuban officials such as Carlos Rafael Rodriguez and Fidel Castro. However, the document notes the absence of evidence in CIA records to substantiate Falcon's claims of CIA involvement. It covers Falcon's arrest, his interviews on Cuban media where he discussed his anti-government activities, and his roles within the MRR, including positions as a national coordinator and treasurer. By 1964, Falcon was identified as a political prisoner.
key_findings: Juan Falcon Tamar claimed CIA support for his anti-Cuban activities, including sabotage and assassination plots.
No evidence was found in CIA records to support Falcon's claims of CIA involvement.
Falcon was interviewed on Cuban radio and television, detailing his activities and plans against the Cuban government.
He was arrested with other MRR members in 1962 and was a political prisoner by 1964.
The document provides details on Falcon's roles within the MRR, including as a national coordinator and treasurer.
